The blockade of the JAK pathways leads to a wider suppression of cytokine-mediated responses. JAK 1 and 3 inhibition downregulates IFNÎ³, which has a role in viral clearance
37 and has been associated with an increased risk for herpes-zoster infection.
92 Conversely, JAK 2 inhibition has been proposed as a therapeutic strategy for COVID-19.
93 No definitive conclusions on tofacitinib (JAK 1 and 3 inhibitor) can be drawn in respect to SARS-CoV-2: discontinuation is not currently recommended,
79 but initiation in epidemic areas should be avoided, unless appropriate alternatives are not available.
